question: Devaluation of currency can correct a Balance of Payments deficit because___
option1: It lowers price of exports in foreign currency and rises price of imports in home currency
option2: It raises price of exports in foreign currency and lowers price of imports in home currency
option3: It raises price of exports and imports in foreign currency
option4: It lowers price of exports and imports in home currency
answer: It lowers price of exports in foreign currency and rises price of imports in home currency
explanation: Devaluation refers to fall in the fixed exchange rate between one currency and other. Devaluation is used to correct the balance of payment (BoP) deficit but only as a last resort as it has major repercussions on the domestic economy. Devaluation can correct a BoP deficit because it lowers the price of experts in terms foreign currencies and raise the price of imports on the home market
